notes.text:
An update for kernel-rt is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel-rt packages provide the Real Time Linux Kernel, which enables fine-tuning for systems with extremely high determinism requirements.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: kernel: DAX hugepages not considered during mremap (CVE-2020-10757)

* kernel: buffer overflow in mwifiex_cmd_append_vsie_tlv function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/scan.c (CVE-2020-12653)

* kernel: heap-based buffer overflow in mwifiex_ret_wmm_get_status function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/wmm.c (CVE-2020-12654)

* kernel: use-after-free caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/hid/usbhid/hiddev.c driver (CVE-2019-19527)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* kernel-rt: provide infrastructure to support dual-signing of the kernel (foundation to help address CVE-2020-10713) (BZ#1837438)

* kernel-rt: update to the latest RHEL7.8.z3 source tree (BZ#1848017)
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in hiddev_open in drivers/hid/usbhid/hiddev.c in the USB Human Interface Device class subsystem, where an existing device must be validated prior to its access. The device should also ensure the hiddev_list cleanup occurs at failure, as this may lead to a use-after-free problem, or possibly escalate privileges to an unauthorized user.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/hid/usbhid/hiddev.c driver
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue is rated as Moderate because of the need of physical access to the system.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use-after-free caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/hid/usbhid/hiddev.c driver

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way mremap handled DAX Huge Pages. This flaw allows a local attacker with access to a DAX enabled storage to escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: kernel: DAX hugepages not considered during mremap
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue requires access to a DAX enabled storage.

This issue affects Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 kernels starting with kernel-3.10.0-862, that is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.5 GA kernel. Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 kernels prior to that version are not affected as they did not include the functionality that enabled this issue to be exploited.

Red Hat Product Security is aware of this issue. Updates will be released as they become available.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
Do not use DAX enabled storage.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: kernel: DAX hugepages not considered during mremap

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the way the mwifiex_cmd_append_vsie_tlv()  in Linux kernel's Marvell WiFi-Ex driver handled vendor specific information elements. A local user could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: buffer overflow in mwifiex_cmd_append_vsie_tlv function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/scan.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

In order to mitigate this issue it is possible to prevent the affected code from being loaded by blacklisting the kernel module mwifiex. For instructions relating to how to blacklist a kernel module refer to: https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: buffer overflow in mwifiex_cmd_append_vsie_tlv function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/scan.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. The Marvell mwifiex driver allows a remote WiFi access point to trigger a heap-based memory buffer overflow due to an incorrect memcpy operation. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity and system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: heap-based buffer overflow in mwifiex_ret_wmm_get_status function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/wmm.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

In order to mitigate this issue, it is possible to prevent the affected code from being loaded by blacklisting the kernel module mwifiex. For instructions relating to how to blacklist a kernel module, refer to: https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: heap-based buffer overflow in mwifiex_ret_wmm_get_status function in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/wmm.c
